reviews.text: Although I can kind of understand where the negative reviewers are coming from, I still had a good experience at this property. For a B&B I felt a little more like it was a small hotel but that's mainly because the rest of our trip was in smaller towns out in the country. The staff was helpful and welcoming... the breakfast room is quaintly done. The rooms could use some work, but since we were hardly in it, we didn't seem to mind all that much. We require a place that's clean and safe and obviously want value for our money, but we realize that we're not at the hotel to spend a lot of time at it.
reviews.title: Good for a city B&B

reviews.text: With that said... I recommend this property as I think it will fit most people's needs.
reviews.title: Really solid choice

likes.liked: — Tucked away from the bustle of the big city, yet convenient.

reviews.text: A pleasant B&B with an attentive staff spread over two restored townhouses in Dublin's shmancy Georgian district. Major attractions are 15-20 mins. away by foot or bus (stops out front). Nice breakfast conservatory with a back garden and frolicking dogs.
reviews.title: Fabulous Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and a friend stayed in Waterloo House for two nights last month. We had traveled around Europe and ended our trip in Dublin. I have to say that out of all the hotels we have stayed in during the past few months, Waterloo House was by far the best. The house is very warm and welcoming. As we didn't know much about Dublin, we had a lot of questions about where to go and what to see which the staff where more then willing to answer. Tea and coffee in the room which was great and breakfast in the morning with French toast and waffles, which we couldn't get enough of.
reviews.title: Great Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Waterloo House and the staff reflect the friendly, warm and beautiful city of Dublin and I’ll be back for sure.
reviews.title: Highly recommended
Great guesthouse in central Dublin
reviews.text: We four couples from Australia travelled around Ireland recently, and booked B&Bs/Guesthouse via the net. We finished in Dublin, where Waterloo House proved to be a very ideal base for geting around all the many great things to see and do in Dublin. Within walking distance of Trinity College and all central points of interests, and with a number of good pubs and restaurants quite close by. Off street parking - we drove in and parked, and did not get back in the vehicles until we drove out to the airport on leaving Ireland. The staff were very friendly and helpful - they turned down the central heating when we suggested it was too hot the 1st night. And the breakfast room is a delight, and food very good. The accomodation rooms were of a reasonable size with quite good bathrooms, and the bed linen was delicious to get into! And there is wireless internet access, plus a computer for guest use in the beautifully appointed guest lounge. Highly recommended!
I'd go back just to see the dogs again!
reviews.title: Wonderful
A great little Dublin hotel
reviews.text: The hotel was very pleasant. Was able to check in at 10am after an all-night flight and catch a nap before discovering Dublin.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The facility was top notch. Very recently renovated, it was completely up to date, while retaining the intended look and feel. Breakfast was lovely, and I spent some time in the back yard with the dogs.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.text: They have a free internet PC available (thanks!), and the location is great....far enough away to be quiet and close enough to walk into city centre. Neighborhood is upscale, very safe, and there's at least one 24 hour convenience store just up the road for late night snacks.
reviews.title: Great choice

reviews.text: I'm quite surprised at all the positive reviews on Waterloo House as my experience was really far from positive. Perhaps the problem was that I was there for business and it is just not cut out for business travellers. Problems included having to move rooms becasue mine was so cold and there was no way to alter the temperature; the wireless network didn't work and when it did work it was very limited. Breakfast was poor - very sad looking fruit and what looked like diluted marmalade and jams - not pleasant.They were doing some work when I was there and I had to request for the hammering to stop whilst I had breakfast as I was getting a major headache. Certainly wouldn't go back and wouldn't recommend it to others.
reviews.title: Thumbs down...

reviews.text: This B&B had received stirling reviews on TripAdvisor, which influenced my decision to book three double rooms for a long weekend in Dublin to celebrate a 60th birthday. We were not disappointed. Located in leafy, well-to-do Ballsbridge, a 15-minute walk from the city centre, it was lovely and quiet—a real plus point as we'd heard the centre could be raucous in the evenings. The breakfast was delicious; the service was excellent. We were left to our own devices (a good thing in our book) and the rooms were adequately equipped with tv, hairdryer, tea/coffee etc and cleaned immaculately every day. The only minor quibble is that the rooms were quite warm—we turned our radiator off. I would definitely recommend this accommodation, and if you can, pay a visit to Roly's down the road—the perfect restaurant for a celebration.
reviews.title: Perfect weekend stay
Excellant out of town accomodation
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 3 night break at Waterloo House and would definitely recommend it. Whilst the hotel is situated slightly out of town, it is just a 15 minutes walk from St Stephens Square and other city centre attractions (8 euros in a taxi) and on the local and airport bus routes.

The welcome and service was exceptional, and having rang the management, prior to our visit, to advise that we were celebrating our engagement that weekend, at our request they went the extra mile and provided rose, champagne and chocolates in our room (although not free I'd hasten to add). The choice of breakfast was good - full irish, catch of the day, french toast or porridge, and the room was clean, with replacement towels and toiletries every day. If you don't want to venture too far on an evening, there are several shops, bars and restaurants just round the corner. I would definitely recommend Roly's Restaurant if you don't mind spending a little extra, having won several awards for its food and value for money, which is just 10 minutes walk from the guest house.
reviews.title: Fantastic Guesthouse & Location

reviews.text: My wife and I, along with my father and some other members of my family stayed at Waterloo Hse on Saturday 02/12/06.
reviews.title: Return Visitor

likes.liked: — It is both comfortable and beautiful
likes.disliked: — I can't really think of anything I didn't like.

reviews.text: We have just returned from 3 days stay at the Waterloo House. Everyone from the staff was so lovely with us the room was perfect very clean nice and specios tea tray and everything we needed was there . The breakfast was very good we did not miss anything. We will be back in Waterloo House for shore againe.
reviews.title: we love it
Disappointed
reviews.text: My sisters and I selected this b&b because of the favorable ratings on TA. The host/owner was no where to be seen . The staff was multinational (students at university) who didn't seem to speak English. We're Southerners, making it had for them to understand us, and hard for us to understand them. The rooms could use a bit of spiffing up, as they have a worn, tired look. If you are going to serve breakfast in the solarium, you should find another place to put you dogs, as having breakfast and watching them relieve themselves is unappietizing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ireland is very expensive at the moment, so I decided to save a little on lodging by going with a bed and breakfast. By the conclusion of my five day stay, I regretted that decision.
reviews.title: Not worth the price

likes.liked: — Good location in a well-maintained building
likes.disliked: — Seems like they regarded guests as a nuisance to be endured, not accomodated.

reviews.text: I can verify all of the negative comments here. When I checked in, my room was missing bath linens and the advertised in-room teapot. I called up to reception to get some towels, and got the most baffled response, as if it were odd to want to clean up after a day of travelling.
reviews.title: Would not return

likes.disliked: — lack of service; property is a bit run down

reviews.text: The teapot never showed up, and the towel set that arrived did not include a washcloth. (In fact, three days later my bathmat went missing, never to be seen again.) My window was painted shut, preventing me from enjoying the spring air (although safety bars were in place, and other rooms' did not have that problem.) My entire floor was under construction, with boxes of plumbing and furniture piled in the hallway, and yes, the hot water ran out on my last day.
reviews.title: Good Choice
